titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Frank Deutscher Company records 1978.143
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was originally processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2024-02-09 14:56:04 +0000.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.abstract: Property appraisals, sale contracts, and other documents from the records of the Frank Deutscher Company, a real estate firm located at 16 Court Street in Brooklyn.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged into three series by type. Series 1: Edison Electric Illuminating Company appraisals is arranged by parcel number. Series 2: Sales contracts and Series 3: Other materials are arranged chronologically.

bioghist.head: Historical note
bioghist.p: The Frank Deutscher Company was a real estate firm located at 16 Court Street in Brooklyn.
Howard C. Pyle and Company was founded in 1904 by Howard C. Pyle and George H. Gray, and the company's name was changed to the Gray-Pyle Real Estate Company in 1919.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Frank Deutscher Company records, 1978.143, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Public Library, Center for Brooklyn History.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was rehoused and the finding aid revised by Dee Bowers in 2024. At that time, fragile documents in the Edison Electric Illuminating Company appraisals (Series 1) were photocopied and the originals discarded.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Brooklyn Real Estate Board magazines and bulletins (ARC.177)
Brooklyn, Queens, and Long Island real estate brochure collection (ARC.296)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Property appraisals, sale contracts, and other documents from the records of the Frank Deutscher Company, a real estate firm located at 16 Court Street in Brooklyn. The appraisals primarily relate to 20 parcels of land owned by the Edison Electric Illuminating Company (1906) and were apparently conducted by Howard C. Pyle and Company. The sale contracts date to the early 1920s and relate mostly to properties in Brooklyn Heights and Downtown Brooklyn, though two properties in Midwood are also included. Other materials include information about the Bay Ridge Theatre property on 3rd Avenue and a pamphlet from Edward Lyons, Inc. listing properties for sale.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: While many items at the Center for Brooklyn History are unrestricted, we do not own reproduction rights to all materials. Be aware of the several kinds of rights that might apply: copyright, licensing and trademarks. The researcher assumes all responsibility for copyright questions.
